rows.text_1_facilitator::eng:
Today's topic is about calm consequences.

Our actions have consequences. Some consequences happen naturally (‚Äúif you break something, you can‚Äôt use it anymore‚Äù). Other consequences we set as a family to motivate us to follow the rules (‚Äúif you come home late, you can‚Äôt go out with friends tomorrow‚Äù).

HOW you set and use consequences together matters.

Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer.

rows.media_transcript::eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is calm consequences.

It is important that when we introduce consequences to our teenagers we involve them, but also important that we are calm when we introduce consequences.

That will assist us to agree on introducing calm consequences to our teenagers, and our teenagers will easily remember them when they are involved and that will make them responsible.

rows.text_1_facilitator::eng: Calm consequences work best when they are fair, agreed on together, and followed through consistently - not in anger.

rows.media_transcript::eng:
When my teenagers did something to make me angry, I would shout at them and punish them right away. But the next time they did it again! I could not understand why they did not hear me even when I shouted.

@global.app_name helped me understand that my teenagers will listen to me more when I am calm. So, when something happens, I take a deep breath and say ‚Äúwe will talk about this later when we are both calm.‚Äù

We even agree on the consequences together now before something goes wrong. This has worked wonders ‚Äì I have seen a huge change in my teen‚Äôs behaviour now that they are more involved, and I have less stress.

I wish I knew this long ago, but it is never too late to start!

Teens often break rules. This is normal - growing up is a difficult time when they are learning about who they are.

Luckily, there are ways to discipline without getting angry or using violence‚Ä¶ and they work well!

Giving calm consequences is important because it helps teens learn from their actions and take responsibility for their choices.

rows.text_1_facilitator::eng: Here are some tips to help you with calm consequences:
rows.section_1_text::eng:
Check you are both calm. Take a few breaths. Explain to your teen why you are concerned about their behaviour.

Explain the reasons why the rule mattered. You can share your feelings ‚Äì it is okay to say you are disappointed.
rows.section_1_extra_text::eng: How you introduce calm consequences is important. When you involve your teen, things usually go better!
rows.section_2_text::eng:
Plan consequences with your teen for following and not following the rule.

Ask for their ideas. Talk until you agree on something realistic.

Make a consequence for NOT following the rule and a privilege when they DO follow the rule.
rows.section_2_extra_text::eng: Remember, consequences are more successful if you discuss and agree in advance with teens before you apply them.
rows.section_3_text::eng:
**When your teen follows the rule, give praise and privileges!** 
They will feel respected and valued. Remember: The more we praise them, the more they will show that good behaviour!


**When your teen does not follow the rule, follow through with the consequence.** 
When your teen breaks the rule, calmly give the consequence. This should be FAIR (not too harsh), IMMEDIATE (do it straight away), CONSISTENT (same every time).
rows.section_3_extra_text::eng: Remember, you can also agree on GOOD consequences for GOOD actions to see more positive behaviour!

rows.media_title::eng: Tap play to hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_6.name learned to appreciate calm consequences
rows.media_transcript::eng:
My mom and dad would always punish me when they were angry with me. They would shout at me and I would also get angry. I often did not follow the rules, because they were too harsh, I did not understand what they were saying, or I would not even bother listening to them, because we were all angry.

One day, they asked me: Let's think together what the consequence should be for not coming home in time. It was great to give my view ‚Äì before something happens that makes us all angry. We are all calm and agree first. It is easier for me to follow the rules now because I know I agreed on the rule and on the consequence if I do not follow the rule.
